revised_title: Self-Propulsion of Non-Spherical Deformable Shapes in a Perfect Fluid
tldr: The authors study the hydrodynamics of a general three-dimensional deformable body moving in a perfect fluid, focusing on the self-propulsion of non-spherical shapes. They apply the Lagally theorem to determine the induced velocity of self-propulsion and demonstrate the results for prolate and oblate spheroidal shapes. The study shows that non-spherical shapes can propel themselves persistently through the fluid due to resonant interactions between shape and volume modes.
